answers.answer: Hello,Thanks for posting your query.I can understand your concern and the condition that you are having is called erectile dysfunction.In most of the cases, erectile dysfunction is psychological in nature. It usually goes away with proper counseling and interactive sessions with the patient. Other causes are diabetes, depression, autonomic nervous system problem, excessive alcohol ingestion or tobacco smoking, heart or thyroid conditions and poor circulation.In your case, you need to be properly examined and investigated to pinpoint the diagnosis. As I have mentioned earlier, in young men, mostly it is due to psychological causes. However you need to have your blood sugar levels, complete blood count, thyroid function tests and cardiac function evaluated.Hope that this information helps and hope that you will get better soon.Wishing you good health.

question: my penis has been damaged by too much pulling ,one day i was having a morning erection , i held it and something in side just burst , i heard a pop sound it just fell down . this happened a year ago , after some time a month or so my erection came back .  but was not as strong as it used to be . in a flacid state i could pull my penis and it would become longer . but i did not realiase by doing that i was actually streching and causing futher damage . my erections started to become softer and and softer and now am unable to any erection at all . can i know what has damaged a how i repair this ?
title: damaged penis
